metadata.title: CVE-2019-3886 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An incorrect permissions check was discovered in libvirt 4.8.0 and above.The readonly permission was allowed to invoke APIs depending on the guestagent, which could lead to potentially disclosing unintended information ordenial of service by causing libvirt to block.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3886` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 5.4.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-clients - 5.4.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon - 5.4.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 5.4.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 5.4.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 5.4.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-system - 5.4.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-sanlock - 5.4.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-wireshark - 5.4.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt0 - 5.4.0-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-0ubuntu1').
